page.title: 04BLACKHEATH
page.content: Blackheath is an example of a village which has grown up since the 19th century.Nobody really knows why it is called Blackheath but people believe it is because the heathland soil is a dark colour.There was never an early settlement at Blackheath because the ground was not suitable for farming and because there wasn't a good water supply, only a well. The people of Blackheath worked in the gunpowder factory at Chilworth because there were no other jobs around.In 1895 there were about 300 people living in Blackheath now there are only 180 because the small cottages have been knocked down and bigger houses have been built in their places.In the future the village probably won't expand any more.There are few faciities in the village. There is only one bus a week.
